content.webTitle: West Ham v Arsenal: match preview

fields.headline: West Ham v Arsenal: match preview
fields.bodyText: Arsenal are the only team in the league not to have won a match in their last six and are winless since 6 October. Put simply this is relegation form. The club must find a permanent replacement for Unai Emery – crucially not Freddie Ljungberg – quickly to turn things around. West Ham reverted to type after beating Chelsea but the spiralling atomic nightmare that is Arsenal should provide a chance for Manuel Pellegrini to rebound once again. Michail Antonio’s fitness, or lack thereof, could be crucial to their chances. Graham Searles Monday 8pm Sky Sports Premier League Venue London Stadium Last season West Ham 1 Arsenal 0 Referee Mike Dean This season G12 Y53 R2 4.58 cards/game Odds H 11-4 A 19-20 D 3-1 WEST HAM Subs from Roberto, Cardoso, Diop, Reid, Masuaku, Zabaleta, Sánchez, Coventry, Yarmolenko, Ajeti, Holland, Haller, Wilshere Doubtful Antonio, Wilshere (both groin) Injured Fabianski (hip, 28 Dec), Lanzini (shoulder, Jan) Suspended None Discipline Y29 R1 Form DLLLWL Leading scorer Haller 4 ARSENAL Subs from Martínez, Kolasinac, Nelson, Mustafi, Martinelli, Saka, Smith Rowe, Mavropanos, Willock, Maitland-Niles, Lacazette Doubtful None Injured Ceballos (hamstring, 21 Dec), Holding (knee, unknown) Suspended None Discipline Y37 R1 Form DDLDDL Leading scorer Aubameyang 10
